What is Supervertaler?

The evolution from simple AI translation to intelligent CAT tool

üå±

Where It Started

Supervertaler began as a simple tool: export your bilingual document from memoQ, manually copy the source column into a text file, let Supervertaler translate it using AI with custom prompts, then paste it back and reimport into memoQ.

It worked, but it was manual. Tedious. Limited.

üöÄ

Where It's Going

The new Supervertaler does all of that‚Äîand a whole lot more. It's evolving into a full-fledged CAT tool with all the features you'd expect:

  • ‚úÖ Grid-based translation interface
  • ‚úÖ Translation memory support
  • ‚úÖ Glossary integration
  • ‚úÖ memoQ & CafeTran bilingual workflows
ü§ñ

What Makes It Different

But here's what no other CAT tool currently offers:

A Full-Blown AI-Powered Prompt Manager & Library

Not only can you create, store, and manage system prompts‚ÄîSupervertaler includes an AI-powered system that generates those prompts automatically based on your document.

üí≠

The Vision

Imagine this conversation:

Supervertaler: "Hmm, what kind of document are you translating?"
Supervertaler: "I see. Well, in that case, I recommend you use the following:"
  • ‚ú® System prompt (domain-specific strategy)
  • ‚ú® Custom instructions (project-specific rules)
Supervertaler: "Please allow me to create them for you‚Äîand then use them to actually translate your project, while you sit back and make tea." ‚òï

That's the future. And it's almost here.

Data Privacy & Security

Honest, transparent information about how your data is handled

üîí

Your Data, Your Control

Supervertaler runs on YOUR computer. There is no Supervertaler company server. Your documents, translation memory, and glossaries never leave your machine unless you choose to send them to an AI provider for translation.

üåê

What Happens When You Use AI Translation

Reality: When you click "Translate," the text you select is sent to the LLM provider's servers (OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google). This is how AI translation works‚Äîthe AI models run on their infrastructure. Supervertaler does NOT process translations locally.

Important: This means your document content temporarily reaches these providers' systems.

‚úÖ

Data Protection: Default Terms

  • OpenAI: Does NOT use API data for model training (by default). Enterprise plans available with zero-retention guarantees.
  • Anthropic (Claude): Does NOT use API data for training. Has explicit no-retention policy.
  • Google Generative AI: Similar policies with SOC 2 compliance available.

All providers offer data processing agreements (DPAs) and enterprise plans with enhanced privacy.

üîê

For Confidential / NDA Work

Recommended approach:

  • Use enterprise/business plans from your chosen LLM provider
  • Ensure Data Processing Agreement (DPA) is in place
  • Confirm zero data retention guarantee
  • Verify SOC 2 Type II compliance
  • Check GDPR/regional compliance with your provider

Most enterprise plans explicitly prohibit data use beyond your specific requests.

üíæ

What You Control

  • ‚úì Choose which AI provider(s) to use
  • ‚úì Your API keys (never stored by Supervertaler)
  • ‚úì What gets sent: Only text you explicitly translate
  • ‚úì Which documents to work with locally vs. via AI
  • ‚úì Translation memory stays 100% local
  • ‚úì Glossaries and custom instructions stay local
üîç

Open Source = Transparent

Supervertaler is fully open source on GitHub. You can audit the code yourself to verify exactly how your data is handled. No hidden data collection, no telemetry, no analytics‚Äîjust the code you can review.

Bottom Line: Using Supervertaler with external LLM APIs involves a tradeoff: You get powerful AI translation capabilities, but your content temporarily reaches the provider's servers. For confidential work, use enterprise plans with proper data agreements in place.

Read full privacy & confidentiality FAQ ‚Üí
